node.title: Dwan Price says gender bias drove her out of medical research â€” and she's not alone
node.alt: A woman smiling at the camera while sitting in front of a computer.
node.description: Damning new analysis suggests gender bias in Australia's funding system may be forcing skilled medical scientists out of research.
node.content:
["Molecular biologist Dr Dwan Price knows how hard this time of the year can be, especially for allergy sufferers.", "Her research into thunderstorm asthma was helping develop new allergen detection systems in Victoria, where 10 people died in a single storm event in 2016, sparking a coronial inquiry.", "\"It's not as though it was some romantic scientific endeavour; it had incredible public health application,\" she says.", "But spring is a tough season for another reason \u2014 it's when many in Australia's medical research fraternity find out if their projects will flourish or fail.", "\"You know that the odds are against you, so it's nerve-wracking. Ninety per cent of the time it will be incredibly disappointing,\" Dr Price says.", "But this year she feels different. That's because the accomplished scientist has just left her career in research to take up a government policy role with the Victorian Department of Health.", "\"Being a medical researcher is very much an identity, so it's not a decision that anyone takes lightly.\"", "", "
Science Friction: My life in medical research is on life support
", "Over the past two years, Dr Price was part of two National Health and Medical Research Council (NHMRC) grant applications, but neither was successful.", "After years of cobbling together short-term contracts and funds to keep her research going, Dr Price says she's had enough.", "\"The reason why \u2026 90 per cent of us struggle to succeed is because the system is underfunded and fundamentally flawed,\" she says.", "Last month, 90.5 per cent of the 2,503 scientists who applied for NHMRC Ideas Grants \u2014\u00a0one of the major sources of funding for Australian medical research \u2014\u00a0missed out.", "Dr Price says this is not a reflection of research quality.", "\"I don't think I failed in the system. I think the system failed me.\"", "
'Clear evidence of gender bias in the system'
", "Eminent stem cell researcher Professor Louise Purton has tracked NHMRC grant outcomes over three years.", "She says women at early career stages are funded to a similar extent to their male peers, but bias could be locking them out of leading their own labs and teams.", "\"There were approximately less than half the number of women than men being funded [at] the independent laboratory head stage,\" Professor Purton says.", "\"And that's where we're starting to see women drop out.\"", "Women at this\u00a0level also received approximately $500,000 less than the men [at the junior laboratory head level in basic science].", "Professor Purton, from St Vincent's Institute of Medical Research, says that stark difference is critical to a lab's overall output.", "\"There will be less publications, and publications are a key performance indicator in our field.\"", "The NHMRC revamped its grants in 2019 to make them more accessible for all career stages.", "Investigator Grants are designed to provide the highest-performing researchers with five years of funding for both their salary and research support. The amount awarded is based on peer review.", "\"Women are receiving lower scores than men,\" Professor\u00a0Purton says.", "\"It's not because of the quality of our work, it's because of the gender bias in the peer review system that is allocating the funding.\"", "This is despite the NHMRC recently trialing gender-neutral language in grant applications, and factoring in how individual circumstances \u2014\u00a0including career disruptions to raise children \u2014\u00a0may have affected output.", "But Professor Purton says women without family or carer responsibilities have been similarly affected.", "\"There is clear evidence of gender bias in the system; that if you're a woman or a non-binary person, you are automatically considered not to be as good a researcher as a man.", "This year the NHMRC received more applications for Investigator Grants from women than men at emerging leadership levels (up to 10 years post-PhD) \u2014\u00a0but at more senior levels, men dominated.", "\"This reflects the gender distribution by seniority in the health and medical research sector,\" an NHMRC representative told Science Friction.", "At the highest leadership level, where scientists are considered international authorities in their field, four times more applications were received from men than women.", "A higher percentage of women's applications were funded (40.6 per cent compared to 31.7 per cent), but 38 out of 51 grants still went to men, who overall received $66 million more in funding than their senior female peers.", "Professor Purton agrees there will always be winners and losers, but argues systemic bias has accumulative effects across a woman's career.", "\"The women don't get to claim credit for the senior men who have benefited from their ideas and their productivity in the lab,\" she says.", "\"I could do that for a number of men who are doing really well in the system.\"", "
Medical science careers on life support
", "", "
Alice McGovern says it's \"really sad Australia doesn't see the importance in medical research anymore\".(Supplied: Alice McGovern)
", "Neuroscientist Dr Alice McGovern investigates the impact of viral infections like influenza on the nervous system, and by every measure is very successful \u2014 receiving an NHMRC Early Career fellowship and then an NHMRC Ideas Grant.", "Her next step as an early career researcher would traditionally be to set up her own lab, but this year she was rejected for 10 grants of different sizes and sources, including two NHMRC grants.", "When her current two-year contract runs out in 2023 (her university initially offered her only one year), she thinks she'll need to leave the field she's spent over a decade of her life building.", "\"It's really hard to separate your self-worth from the funding system at the moment,\" says Dr McGovern, adding that many of her peers are in the same situation.", "\"I don't want to be on one of those yearly cycles where you get to this point at the end of every year and you have to question, 'what am I doing next year?'", "\"I'm a single parent \u2026\u00a0and I'm not finding security in medical research anymore.", "", "
Alison Rice reinvented her career after almost three decades in stem cell research.(Supplied: Alice McGovern)
", "A decade ago, Dr Alison Rice's 27-year international career in stem cell research ended with one rejected NHMRC grant application.", "\"I went into a budget meeting to find out what was going to be available for next year and saw zeros on my budget, and I said, 'Does this mean I don't have a job next year?' They said, 'Yep, that's right, didn't you know?'\"", "Now deputy director of CSIRO's Synthetic Biology Future Science Platform, Dr Rice re-invented her career by translating her research skills into savvy business-speak.", "\"A lot of people are flying high and then they can't fly any further,\" she says.", "
Call for 50:50 split in funding
", "The NHMRC says it's working to minimise gender inequality, including funding additional high-scoring applications from women who just miss out on grants.", "\"[This] has markedly reduced the gap between men's and women's funded rates in the Investigator Grant scheme,\" an NHMRC spokesperson says.", "\"[The] NHMRC considers that gender equality will have been achieved when similar numbers of women and men apply for, and are funded through, all NHMRC funding schemes.\"", "Dr Purton acknowledges the efforts by the NHMRC, but says more needs to be done.", "\"It's been known for over 20 years that very few women are represented at the top level.", "\"We [Equity in Australian STEMM] are calling for an equal slate of funding \u2014 a 50-50 funding split, with a pot for non-binary [researchers] as well.\"", "
Future of medical research in Australia
", "The federal government has invested in a $20 billion long-term Medical Research Future Fund, but scientists say it has limited scope.", "\"That funding is largely inaccessible to the biomedical researchers who are not clinicians,\"\u00a0Dr Purton says.", "\"Biomedical researchers are the ones who are really at the bench making the discoveries.\"", "Dr Rice says the state of research funding in Australia is unsustainable.", "\"For the last 10 years or more, people have been actively saying there is a big problem.", "\"[We need to] start thinking of this as a crucial industry, rather than something that's nice to have.\"", "Dr Price, meanwhile, has landed on her feet and is loving her new job in COVID-related health policy.", "\"I'm using my STEM skills every single day, and I think I'm using them at a faster and more intense pace than I've ever used them before.", "\"It is the first time in a very long time that I've actually been valued as a scientist.\""]
